Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of the Fomitopsis pinicola complex
with descriptions of six new species from East Asia
Keywords:
Brown-rot fungi, host specialization, multi-gene
phylogeny, polypore, species complex
Abstract:
Fomitopsis pinicola is a common brown-rot fungal species
in northern hemisphere, and it grows on many different gymnosperm and
angiosperm trees. Recent studies showed that it is a species complex and
three species from North America and one species from Europe were
recognized in this complex. In the current study, six new species in
Fomitopsis pinicola complex are discovered from East Asia based on
morphological characters and phylogenetic analyses inferred from
sequences data of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) regions, the
second subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB2) and the translation
elongation factor 1-Î± gene (TEF). Detailed descriptions of the six new
species are provided. Our results also indicated that species of the F.
pinicola complex from East Asia usually have limited distribution areas
and host specialization.
